meanings.sent1: The sublimit amount was smaller than expected.
meanings.sent2: The sublimit temperature made the day more bearable.
meanings.sent3: The sublimit speed of the snail amused the children.
meanings.sent4: Her sublimit patience was like a gentle breeze in a storm.
meanings.sent5: The sublimit size of the toy made it perfect for little hands.

meanings.definition: To make less intense or severe.
meanings.sent1: She tried to sublimit her excitement, but it was difficult.
meanings.sent2: The therapist helped him sublimit his anxiety.
meanings.sent3: He sublimited his laughter during the serious meeting.
meanings.sent4: The calming music sublimited her stress like magic.
meanings.sent5: They decided to sublimit the noise to avoid disturbing others.

meanings.definition: A limit that is below another limit.
meanings.sent1: The insurance policy had a sublimit for jewelry coverage.
meanings.sent2: The sublimit on the credit card prevented overspending.
meanings.sent3: The sublimit on dessert servings was a disappointment.
meanings.sent4: His ambition had no sublimit; he aimed for the stars.
meanings.sent5: The sublimit on characters for the message was frustrating.
